Job Title: Sr. Product Manager, DEX Speed Product and Tech

Location: Bellevue, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Product Management, Project Management

Description:
Description

For millions of customers worldwide, the Amazon name is synonymous with lightning-fast delivery – and the Delivery Experience Speed Tech (DEX Speed Tech) team takes it to the next level, providing those customers with innovative ways to get what they want and need now, enabling the choices they make on every order, every day. We are pioneers in retail invention, and we tackle enormous technical challenges to ensure rapid, fast delivery.

The ideal candidate is thrilled by cutting-edge technology and relishes the opportunity to learn continuously, treating every customer interaction as a chance to create an exceptional, lightning-speed delivery experience. Everyone on the team needs to be entrepreneurial, excited to work in a “green field”, wear many hats and work in a highly collaborative environment that is more startup than big company.

You have a track record of exceptional performance and love working in a dynamic, ambiguous, fast-paced environment in which managing multiple projects and priorities is the norm. You dive deep and like the complexity of systems but drive simple, innovative solutions for customer-facing experiences. You have excellent judgment and high standards. You are an articulate, persuasive communicator and a good writer. People trust and respect you and they like to work with you. You are eager to pioneer new experiences, putting the customer first and challenging current experiences.

Key job responsibilities

We are on the lookout for a Product Leader to join the DEX Speed Tech product team, dedicated to innovating end-to-end shopping experiences for sub same day delivery experience working closely with Operations and tech teams. Your role will be instrumental in delivering products catering to our international marketplaces, all with a relentless focus on rapid execution. This is a high-profile position, requiring close collaboration with tech teams, influence across multiple orgs and businesses. The candidate must have prior experience working with engineering teams and creating roadmap and driving ATL/BTL decisions. Deeply understanding customer needs is paramount as we envision a shopping experience across online and in-store retail that's not only seamless but also delightfully fast.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Bellevue, WA, USA

Basic Qualifications

 5+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience Bachelor's degree or equivalent Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition Experience with end to end product delivery Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product Experience as a product manager or owner Experience owning technology products

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience in influencing senior leadership through data driven insights Experience working across functional teams and senior stakeholders

For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $110,700/year in our lowest geographic market up to $206,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.
